summary: The document is an unclassified identification form related to the JFK Assassination System, focusing on the investigation into the birth records of Manuel Marti, originally named Manuel Adrian Sotomayor-Badillo. It details the surname change by his father in 1963 and touches on Spanish naming traditions. The document, released with deletions, was part of investigations conducted by INSCOM/CSF, an agency affiliated with DOD personnel incident investigations.
key_findings: Manuel Marti's birth name was Manuel Adrian Sotomayor-Badillo.
In 1963, his father changed both his own and his son's surname to Marti.
The document provides insights into Spanish naming traditions, which include the use of both parents' surnames.
The investigation was carried out by INSCOM/CSF, indicating its connection to DOD-affiliated personnel incident investigations.
